subject: Re: [junit] Re: Reliability of Timeout
msgSnippet: ... No, any API call or even certain Java statements will be preemptable (that s how threads get scheduled). To abort a for(;;) I think you need thread.stop.
messageBody:
On 2/7/06, Ben Maurer <bmaurer@...> wrote:
>
> for (;;) *DOES* have yield points -- you need it for a correctly
> functioning GC. However, java does not use these yield points by
> default, it only uses one with sleep.


No, any API call or even certain Java statements will be preemptable (that's
how threads get scheduled).

To abort a for(;;) I think you need thread.stop.


Yes, stop() will work. interrupt() won't, though.
